title: Switcher - Usage Examples
description: Toggle between two content states with single button. Common for pricing (monthly/yearly), comparisons (before/after), or A/B content display. Supports 4 visual styles.

examples.name: Pricing Switcher - Monthly/Yearly (Style 1)
examples.description: Toggle pricing display between monthly and yearly plans
examples.visualDescription: Toggle switch with 'Monthly' and 'Yearly' labels. Style-1: iOS-style sliding toggle. Active label highlighted. Clicking switches pricing tables below. Center-aligned. Common for SaaS pricing pages.
examples.useCase: Pricing tables (monthly/yearly), subscription plans, billing cycles

examples.name: Before/After Comparison Switcher
examples.description: Toggle between before and after states
examples.visualDescription: Switch between 'Before' and 'After' content. Shows transformation, results, or changes. Style-2: Rounded toggle with labels inside. Useful for portfolio, testimonials, case studies.
examples.useCase: Portfolio transformations, case studies, before/after photos, results showcase

attributes.desc1: Before renovation: outdated kitchen, old appliances, poor lighting.
attributes.desc2: After renovation: modern design, new appliances, perfect lighting. Total transformation!

examples.name: Feature Comparison Switcher (Style 3)
examples.description: Toggle between two product/plan feature lists
examples.visualDescription: Style-3: Tab-like buttons side by side. 'Basic' vs 'Pro' features. Clicking tab shows different feature list. Clean, professional appearance. Good for plan comparisons.
examples.useCase: Plan comparisons, feature toggles, product variations

examples.name: Content Toggle with Templates (Style 4)
examples.description: Switch between two reusable block templates
examples.visualDescription: Style-4: Underline indicator style. Toggle between complex reusable blocks (not simple text). Each side can load entire saved template. Powerful for complex layouts.
examples.useCase: Complex content switching, template-based content, reusable layouts

examples.name: Styled Switcher - Purple Theme
examples.description: Fully styled switcher with custom colors and typography
examples.visualDescription: Purple gradient theme. Toggle switch: white text on purple gradient. Active label: darker purple. Switch slider: white circle on purple track. Matches brand colors. 16px uppercase labels with letter-spacing.
examples.useCase: Branded sections, custom designs, themed pages

validationRules.title1: Required. Label for first switch option. Default: 'Switch 1'.
validationRules.title2: Required. Label for second switch option. Default: 'Switch 2'.
validationRules.desc1: Required when source1: 'content'. HTML content for first option.
validationRules.desc2: Required when source2: 'content'. HTML content for second option.
validationRules.blockTemp1: Required when source1: 'template'. Reusable block ID for first option.
validationRules.blockTemp2: Required when source2: 'template'. Reusable block ID for second option.
validationRules.showBtn: Boolean. Show/hide toggle button. Default: true. If false, content is static.
validationRules.switchWidth: Responsive object. Max-width for style-3 and style-4 toggles. Recommended: 300-500px.

warnings: CRITICAL: Never modify block_id - breaks switcher.
source: 'template' requires blockTemp to be valid reusable block ID.
showBtn: false makes switcher non-interactive (always shows first option).
switchStyle: 'style-3'/'style-4' require switchWidth to be set for proper appearance.
Empty desc1/desc2 when source: 'content' creates blank content area.
Very different content heights between options can cause layout jump when switching.
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set blockTemp when using source: 'template' (content doesn't load)
Not providing desc when source: 'content' (blank switcher)
Setting switchWidth too narrow on style-3/style-4 (text overflow)
Using very long title1/title2 text (breaks toggle layout)
Not testing both switch states (only testing default)
Forgetting showBtn: true (switcher appears but doesn't toggle)
bestPractices: Title length: 1-2 words for clean toggle appearance
Content height: Keep similar heights for smooth switching
Use style-1/style-2 for pricing toggles (modern, familiar pattern)
Use style-3/style-4 for feature comparisons (tab-like clarity)
switchWidth for style-3/style-4: 300-500px for comfortable labels
Align center for pricing, left for content comparisons
Test both options have content - empty states confuse users
Use templates (source: 'template') for complex pricing tables
Color contrast: Ensure labels readable in both active/inactive states

layoutContext.parentBlocks: Can be used in any container
layoutContext.childBlocks: Can use tp-switch-inner child blocks OR desc1/desc2 inline content
layoutContext.switchingBehavior: Clicking toggle hides one content, shows other. No animation by default (instant switch).
layoutContext.styleVariations: style-1 = iOS toggle, style-2 = rounded toggle, style-3 = tabs, style-4 = underline tabs

relatedBlocks.tp-switch-inner: Child block for switcher content (alternative to desc1/desc2)
relatedBlocks.tp-pricing-table: Often used inside switcher for pricing toggles
